alert.note: Alert for Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:47AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Union County, Union and north central Ouachita Parishes through 445 AM CDT... At 346 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ingalls to near Junction City. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... El Dorado, Huttig, Farmerville, Strong, Calion, Wesson, Urbana, Lawson, Lapile, Moro Bay State Park, Marion, Felsenthal, Spearsville, Newell, New London, Oakland, Haile, Pigeon Hill, Rocky Branch and Cecil. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for south central Arkansas...and north central Louisiana.
